immediately on the defensive feel guilty or something not out to offend anyone really just want to know breastfed for month and then let it go my son seemed very allergic to me his whole scalp was covered in scabs his whole face was covered in painful looking pimples he spit up breastmilk more than he spit up formula once stopped breastfeeding for week all those problems cleared right up viola might ve tried eliminating various things from my diet but have my own problems have horrible ibs and food sensitivities almost everything makes me sick and have very limited diet can not go eliminating many of the few foods that can eat so quit breastfeeding and my son seemed healthier for it have known women who simply did want to do it so they did they bent over backwards in other ways for their children but this one thing is something they wanted to do have another friend who found breastfeeding extremely painful right from the start so she did want to do it and she did her child is perfectly healthy pre teen have pcos and never made more than ounces and most of that was only from my right breast even with supplements went for about months of every feeding breast feeding one boob and then following up with bottle it took forever next time if my supply is still bad probably wo try to breastfeed more than weeks still feel guilty about it though that is amazing that you gave it six months know moms who have had supply issues with their first baby due to pcos who did have problems the next baby so fingers crossed for you but truly believe that even just making the effort and whatever breastmilk you can give to your baby is wonderful gift can only imagine how exhausting double feeding was hated it had bad experience right off the back with my son having to be re admitted with jaundice after being home whole day and half engorged sooo much he would not could not latch had to pump right away did not get to talk to lactation specialist when was in the hospital after gave birth and only talked to one when we were at the nicu by that point had already found giving bottle much easier so got stuck in having to pump before his feeding and if could after to get ready for the next kept up ok until he bumped to ounces per feeding suddenly all had in the freezer was vanishing because hated being stuck for hours each day to the pump weeks after birth would be pumping for 30 minutes and barely get ounces started using formula every other feeding and basically dried up yes wish he could have breast milk longer but did what could and he is doing fantastic and super healthy at months deleted deleted deleted the lack of breastmilk made the decision pretty easy deleted have made choice necessarily but it is something ve been thinking about so ll share currently struggling with whether or not want to with my second it was really really really hard with my daughter she was cluster feeder milk would come out very fast or much at all was engorged and in lot of pain my nipples bled and scabbed over taking shower was excruciatingly painful the sleep deprivation made me hallucinate it seemed like she would latch on to each side for 45 minutes at time then fall asleep for 30 minutes wake up and want to do it all over again there were times when felt like literally peeling the skin off my chest and never doing it again the lactation consultant spoke with after week three of no sleep and feeling like was going insane suggested sterilize needle and try to open the pores on my nipples larger was horrified also really wanted her dad to be able to feed bond with her so pumped as much as could and ended up supplementing with formula know things could be lot different with the next baby but am apprehensive 37 years old my husband works long hours and have an extremely energetic child who almost four trying to figure out how to juggle keeping up with her breastfeeding an infant and still keeping up with all my other responsibilities also have to start working soon after having the baby no matter what end up doing most likely it wo be the sort of job where can go into locked room and pump in peace and we ca survive for very long on just my husband income think people are defensive about it because formula is no longer the go to automatic choice for many moms there definite push back to more natural childbirth childcare and feeding even my friends who had serious medical issues that made it impossible to breastfeed their babies felt tremendous overwhelming guilt that they failed somehow women who ve planned for natural births but ended up with emergency sections feel as if they ve failed when it comes right down to it think *most* people understand that breast is best being unable to do it when you really want to is upsetting but *choosing* not to well you know that opens the door to all sorts of judgment that those moms do really need or want so they stick to the response you have heard deleted deleted the first reason is time work full time took weeks off of work when had my daughter that six weeks that could have breastfed but did because it only six weeks and then was back to work run family practice office am constantly on the phone working with patients receiving checking out am the billing department the insurance specialist the medical records department answer all phone calls and faxes and emails that come in do have time to pump breastfeeding after that weeks would be impossible so decided that would skip the potential latching supply weening problems and just enjoy spending time with my baby before went back to work the second reason is no family support was bottle fed as were all of my siblings my sisters had children before did and their children were all bottle fed it not like my family discouraged breastfeeding they would have tried to convert me if had breastfed but they would ask why and would have to explain and defend choice that was really gun ho about in the first place considered breastfeeding but was enthusiastic about it those are my biggest reasons my smaller reasons include not caring for the breast pain wanting to give my husband chance to bond with her being able to go out for the day without breastfeeding in public or pumping or leaking all over my shirt the bottom line is in my family and with our lifestyle breastfeeding was worth the hassle so we formula fed and our daughter is healthy and wonderful and do not nor will ever regret not breastfeeding her it was the best choice for our family edit you may not get lot of answers from people who
